intro: Pedicularis szetschuanica var. angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes hemiparasitic plants that derive some nutrients from their host plants. The species is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and vivid orange or red flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It typically grows in alpine meadows and rocky habitats at high elevations. Due to its striking appearance and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
